title: 111_hr6413
content: SECTION 1. Payment in lieu of a cost-of-living adjustment to recipients of Social Security, Supplemental Security Income, Railroad Retirement Benefits, and Veterans Disability Compensation or Pension Benefits. The Secretary of the Treasury will disburse a one-time payment to eligible individuals who are entitled to specific benefit payments or SSI cash benefits. Payments will only be made if no increase occurs in December 2010 under the Social Security Act. The one-time payment to eligible individuals is contingent on receiving a benefit described in subparagraph (D)(i) in the 12-month period before the enactment of the Act. The applicable amount is a percentage of the individual's monthly benefit payment as described in subparagraph (C) or SSI cash. The one-time payment to eligible individuals is based on their benefit payment from December 2010, multiplied by 0.6. If an individual receives multiple benefits, they will receive the higher monthly payment. Funding for appropriations goes to the general fund. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will redirect repayments of assistance provided under the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 to reimburse the general fund of the Treasury for payments made. The monthly insurance benefit payable under various sections of the Social Security Act is described in this clause. The clause describes benefit payments under specific sections of the Social Security Act, including monthly annuities and pensions. The curr_chunk describes benefit payments under specific sections of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974. The curr_chunk outlines benefit payments under specific sections of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974, including compensation or pension payments under certain sections of title 38, United States Code. The curr_chunk specifies benefit payments under specific sections of title 38, United States Code, to eligible recipients such as veterans, surviving spouses, children, or parents as described in section 101. The curr_chunk outlines the requirements for SSI cash benefits, specifying that payments are only made to individuals residing in specific locations or utilizing certain postal addresses. The curr_chunk specifies that individuals can only receive one payment under this section, regardless of eligibility for multiple benefits. Payments are limited based on the individual's entitlement to specific benefits. The curr_chunk outlines conditions for benefit payments under specific sections of the Social Security Act for eligible individuals. The curr_chunk specifies conditions for benefit payments under certain sections of the Social Security Act for eligible individuals, including situations where benefits were not payable or reduced due to specific reasons outlined in the text. The curr_chunk outlines conditions for benefit payments under specific sections of the Social Security Act for eligible individuals, including instances where payments are not due or reissued in the event of the individual's death before payment receipt or deposit. The Secretary of the Treasury will start making benefit payments under the Social Security Act in 2011 before April 1, 2011, and may disburse payments electronically to eligible individuals. The Commissioner of Social Security, the Railroad Retirement Board, and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will certify individuals for benefit payments under the Social Security Act until December 31, 2011, regardless of later determinations of eligibility. Payments under subsection (a) shall not be considered income for federal programs. Payments under subsection (a) are not considered income or resources for the recipient for the month of receipt and the following 9 months for determining eligibility for benefits. The payment is also not considered gross income for tax purposes. Additionally, the payments are protected from assignment under specific provisions of various acts. The Retirement Act of 1974 and section 5301 of title 38, United States Code, apply to payments made under subsection (a) as benefit payments. Payments under this section are subject to reclamation provisions and are not subject to offset. Payments made under this section are not considered benefit payments for the purposes of section 3716 of title 31, United States Code, and are subject to offset for collecting delinquent debts. If an individual's payment is made to a representative payee or fiduciary, the payment will be made to the representative payee or fiduciary. The payment must be used for the individual's benefit, and specific regulations apply to payments based on different entitlements. The regulations in title 38, United States Code, apply to payments based on entitlements to veterans benefits.
